description:
Albert Wiggins, now retired and sipping martinis on the beach as he always wanted, dictates a book about the era of Hunter Rose into a recorder. It is unclear whether it is a true story or if he is making it up.

Lieutenant Polk, a New York detective, hears his captain taking a bribe in the station bathroom, and decides to investigate. He learns that other police officers are involved, as are multiple diamond sellers and the Coast Guard. The investigation becomes more and more complex and worrisome, but he gets more leads. It seems that one of the diamond merchants, Weisburg's, is trying to corner the diamond market through a complex scheme. He tells his partner what's going on, in case something happens to him.

As he learns more, it seems that this scheme is actually even more complex than he thought: Wiesburg seems to be trying to minimize Grendel's cut of the profits. As crime lord of the city, Grendel is dangerous to cross, and the investigation takes on a whole new scope. Polk meets Wiesburg's twin children. Wiesburg himself is an invalid. Finally he finds Wiesburg's new will, which gives almost all his money to the twins. They must be the ones behind it.

This story is notable because it is told almost entirely through a grid of 1.25" square panels, five squares across and five squares down on each page. It also has no ads.

It contains a Mage backup story, Interlude (which is the first of two interludes between The Hero Discovered and The Hero Defined). In it, a young French girl meets her lover at a pond in the woods. The pond has a sculpture of a sea deity riding a chariot pulled by horses in it. She starts to make out with the boy, but then he jumps in the pond and reappears as a black, demonic-looking horse.

The back-up story is written entirely in French.
name: [Story of Lt. Polk]/Interlude Premiere Partie

description:
One of the Justice League's own turns out to be a Manhunter.

The Justice League is betrayed by Rocket Red #7 who turns out be a Robot Manhunter. After almost killing the entire League he is stopped by the Rocket Red Squadron. and later killed when Booster puts a force field around him as he tries to blast him with his last missile. This in turns obliterates the Manhunter. Later Harjavti conspires with the Jack O'Lantern to create a force opposed to the Justice League International.
name: Seeing Red

description:
Reprints Sam Slade's adventures from the pages of weekly sci-fi anthology comic 2000AD.

Cover: Tom Tenney (Sam Slade: Robo-Hunter)

  • Sam Slade: Robo-Hunter - Football Crazy (parts 1-3) (progs 283-285) (John Wagner and Alan Grant - Ian Gibson)
  • Harlem Heroes (parts 7-10) (progs 7-10) (Tom Tully - Dave Gibbons)
name: Sam Slade 14

Classic reprints from British anthology comic 2000AD.

Cover: Ron Randall (Dan Dare)

  • Dan Dare - The Doomsday Machine (parts 1-3) (progs 79-81) (Roy Preston and Nick Landau - Trevor Goring and Garry Leach)
  • The VCs (parts 16-18) (progs 156-158) (Gerry Finley-Day - Cam Kennedy)

Reprints Slaine and Ukko's adventures from the pages of weekly British anthology comic 2000AD.

Cover: Bart Sears (Slaine)

  • Slaine - Time Killer (parts 1-3) (progs 411-413) (Pat Mills - Glenn Fabry (parts 1-2) and David Pugh (part 3))
  • Blackhawk (parts 9-10) (progs 136-137) (Alan Grant - Massimo Belardinelli)
name: slaine 7

description: Classic Strontium Dog reprints from the pages of British anthology comics 2000AD and Starlord.
name: Strontium Dog 7

Classic Judge Dredd reprints from the pages of weekly British anthology comic 2000AD.

Cover: Bart Sears (Judge Dredd)

  • The Switch (prog 369) (John Wagner and Alan Grant - Jim Baikie)
  • Attack of the 50ft Woman (prog 492) (John Wagner and Alan Grant - Garry Leach)
  • Varks (prog 503) (John Wagner and Alan Grant - Kevin O'Neill)
name: Judge Dredd 14

description:
The New Mutants arrived on Bird-Brain's home, a barren rocky island full of caves & dead trees. Quickly they were surrounded by hostile looking Ani-Mates. Meanwhile, in an underground laboratory, the Ani-Mator inspected his latest batch of embryonic ani-mates and destroyed them. An amphibian ani-mate named Bufo gained his master's attention to warn him about the New Mutants' presence on his island. He performed a computer search on them and discovered the New Mutants' identities. The Ani-Mator then decided to capture the New Mutants as specimens to be experimented on.

Outside, the New Mutants were having trouble communicating with the Ani-Mates. Mirage conjured up an image of food, and Bird-Brain gave them the stolen burgers and fries. Whenever some of the more aggressive looking Ani-Mates started to growl, the New Mutants reminded each other how they had powers to protect themselves with. The Ani-Mates didn't like Bird-Brain wearing man's clothes, and were about to attack him when Wolfsbane changed into her transitional form and jumped in to save him. The Ani-Mates stood back, and thought she was another like-creature, like them.

Meanwhile, Sunspot and Warlock returned to Xavier's School for the Gifted. When Warlock tried to pick the lock to the front door, alarms rang and Magneto trapped them. Realising he had captured his prodigal students, he gave them both a huge hug to welcome them home. However, realising that the New Mutants didn't come running to see what all the noise was tipped him off to their absence.

On the Ani-Mator's island, an alarm began to sound. The Ani-Mates and Bird-Brain reacted instinctively. They moved in a hypnotised fashion, walking into an underground maze. The New Mutants were self-assured that their powers could save them from any threats. However, they soon found the dismembered and decaying remains of old Ani-Mates. They managed to save each other from pit-falls and other booby traps, but nothing could prepare them for the sight of recently slain ani-Mates. Wolfsbane broke down in tears and began to pray, which Bird-Brain tried to comprehend. Suddenly there was a scream, and three large doors revealed monstrously huge Ani-Mates.

The New Mutants began to fight for their lives. The ground opened, but Magik teleported out of harm's way. However, the opening unleashed knock out gas, which rendered Wolfsbane unconscious. Creatures overwhelmed Bird-Brain, and Mirage was cought by a bat-like Ani-Mate. Her illusion of the Ani-Mator wasn't enough to save her from the blind bat-creature, and Cannonball was caught in a steal net when he tried to catch her. The fight came to an end when all the New Mutants were captured or unconscious, and the Ani-Mator ordered his creatures to carry them into his laboratory.

The Ani-Mator was angry at Bird-Brain. He had taken extra pride and care in creating Bird-Brain, and was furious that he had run away and begun to wear human clothes. He ranted that his creatures didn't have the right to a name until they had passed his tests, and reminded them all that they were only animals. Wolfsbane argued that they were sentient creatures who could make choices for themselves, comparing them to Adam & Eve in the garden of Eden. When the Ani-Mator grew tired of her aruments, he had one of his slave creatures hit her across the jaw.

The Ani-Mator then ordered the destruction of the Ani-Mates who had first met the New Mutants. He was angry that they had let the humans live, when his law dictated that all trespassers should be instantly killed. Upon his order to kill the creatures of 'Lot F', the animal skull on his head began to resemble one of Mirage's death warnings.

The New Mutants were unable to help. They realised that the deaths of all Bird-Brain's Ani-Mate friends was their fault for foolishly trespassing on the island without enough power or planning to save themselves, let alone the others. Bird-Brain began to pray for his slaughtered friends. This enraged the Ani-Mator even more who ripped the New Mutants uniform from him. Bird-Brain and the other New Mutants were trapped. Held hostage by a ranting & murderous madman.
name: Fang and Claw

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

description:
1. Cover by Joe Staton and Bruce Patterson.
  2. Written by Steve Englehart, penciled by Joe Staton, inked by Ian Gibson, colored by Carl Gafford and lettered by Bob Lappan.
  3. 2 page text piece by Mark Waid and Andrew Helfer.

Millennium Week 2. This is week two of DC's company-wide crossover of 1987. Guardians Herupa Hando Hu and Nadia Safir travel the world, asking the ten special chosen ones to join them in advancing the human race. The Manhunters, who were created by the Guardians as a force for good many years ago, must be stopped.
name: Under

description:
1. Cover by Joe Staton and Bruce Patterson.
  2. Written by Steve Englehart, penciled by Joe Staton, inked by Ian Gibson, colored by Carl Gafford and lettered by Bob Lappan.
  3. 2 page text piece by Mark Waid.

This is week three of DC's company-wide crossover of 1987. The Outsiders and other heroes battle the Manhunters, who were created years ago by the Guardians as a force for good, but are now dedicated to evil. The heroes must stop the Manhunters from destroying the ten special chosen ones who have been selected to advance the human race.
name: Back

description:
1. Cover by Joe Staton and Bruce Patterson.
  2. Written by Steve Englehart, penciled by Joe Staton, inked by Ian Gibson, colored by Carl Gafford and lettered by Bob Lappan.
  3. 2 page text piece by Mark Waid.

This is week four of DC's increasingly repetitious company-wide crossover of 1987. Green Lantern, Flash, and others protect several of the chosen ones, who have been selected to advance the human race. Batman and others search for the Manhunters.
name: Forth

description: Airboy and company are captured and prepared for trial in Bogantilla in ‚ÄúChain of Fools.‚Äù Issue also has an Airboy Index and ‚ÄúBachelor Party‚Äù in which Sky Wolf prepares for his wedding. ¬†
name: Chain Of Fools; Bachelor Party

description:
1. Cover by Joe Staton and Bruce Patterson.
  2. Written by Steve Englehart, penciled by Joe Staton, inked by Ian Gibson, colored by Carl Gafford and lettered by Bob Lappan.
  3. 2 page text piece by Steve Englehart.

This is week five of DC's company-wide crossover of 1987. The two Guardians instruct their chosen ones in the ways of the universe, while Batman, Superman, and others try to stop the Manhunters. But, as we're reminded over and over in this series, "No Man Escapes the Manhunters."
name: In

description:
Overview
When the Boreson family writes a hard luck letter to Concrete, he responds with action: He agrees to work a season on their farm, bringing it into viable condition. Concrete's strength and indefatigability are a great help, and his co-signing of a loan is no less. But it isn't so easy: Larry gets involved in a romance that threatens to create hard feelings, the neighbors resent the special help the Boresons are getting, and there's something very strange about the Boresons themselves. It's up to Concrete to figure out just what their secret is...

Be alert! Watch out for crime," says CAPTAIN CRUSADER! What would happen if you wanted to be a super-hero in New York City? Now, real people can't be super heroes, but don't tell that to Steve Richards! He thinks that he actually is one! Doom Patrol inker Gary Martin (in his first role as writer/artist) brings us a story that pokes fun at the readily accepted notion of how people view "comic book reality." Also, Mark Badger (continuing his own newly-acquired role as writer/artist), doing some of the most innovative and thought-provoking work of his career, brings us another instalment of MASQUE, the mysterious vengeful figure caught up in a story of intrigue and violence!

Chapters

Captain Crusader - Action figure spokesperson, Steve Richards, has had a few setbacks in his burgeoning super-hero career. In an effort to take things more seriously, he embarks upon a new strength and fitness regime. Months later, he feels ready to face the streets once more. He heads to a local bar to dig up some info on criminal deeds.

Masque: As the C.I.A. continue to chase Albert Montoya, The Mask provides some insight into how this whole caper got started.

Babes 'n Arms: Sunny and Toschi salvage their rainy day with a shopping trip to Alomoana mall. Astounded by the lack of crowds, and when Sunny finds her ideal dress and in her size, they can't believe their luck. The only questions are: How long can their obsession for fashion divert them from the alien invasion happening around them? And what are they going to do about it when they finally pull their heads out of the sand?
name: Captain Crusader; The Masque; Babes 'n Arms

description: At Stearn Mansion, Kelly Friday and her mother Gloria reminisce about the past. Kelly shows what she has gathered about her mother's one time boyfriend Jim Stearne, the World War II Mister Monster. Gloria tells Kelly about her break-up with Jim and how she met Joe Friday after Mister Monster's battle with the "Terror of Trezma".

"Point of View" finds Gangbuster's heroism being put to the test.

Notes:

  • Millennium Week 7 crossover.
  • This issue is split into two similar stories: The top half involves Lex Luther, Celia Windward and Combattor and the bottom half involves Lois Lane, Gangbuster and Combattor.
    • 1) Lex Luthor is telling Celia Windward a hypothetical story of a villain named Combattor battling Superman.
    • 2) Jose Delgado and Lois Lane go out on a movie date and the villain Combattor attacks the movies theater and takes Lois hostage in hopes of luring Superman into battle. Instead of Superman showing up for the rescue it is Gangbuster.
  • On page 1 panel 3 the Metro Theatre was showing Good Morning Saigon starring Robin Williams and the movie Mr. Scuba.
  • Gangbuster was paralyzed by Combattor.
name: Point of View

description: Young Robin finds himself in a pickle when he drops in on a drug ring unannounced and unprepared. After Nightwing bails him out, he gives Robin a message for Batman: "I'll stop by the cave tomorrow." There are some words that need to be said and some closure to be had between Batman and Nightwing.
name: White Gold and Truth

description:
Overthrow and his Manhunter team trap Mr. Miracle and Blue Beetle in a probe heading for the Earth's core in "If This Works, It'll Be A Miracle!"

Blue Beetle and Mister Miracle travel to Kord Industries to modify a solar probe to instead be a planetary borer so that they can pursue the Manhunters at the Earth's Core. In so doing they are attacked by Overthrow and a group of Manhunters and trapped inside the device as it begins to heat.
name: If This Works, It'll Be a Miracle!

description:
Final issue. Millennium Week 7. Booster tries to figure out the direction his life will take in 'The End.' Story picks up from events in Millennium #7.

  1. Cover by Dan Jurgens and Ty Templeton.
  2. Written and penciled by Dan Jurgens, inked by Robert Campanella, colored by Gene D'Angelo and lettered by Steve Haynie.
name: The End

description:
Convicted murderer Clifford Zmeck, having taken part in the Major Force Project in 1969, reappears 18 years later in "Sweet Dreams Major Force."

There was another Atom Project! And he is about to make is presents known to the World. But what can Captain Atom do about?
name: Sweet Dreams Major Force

description: Doc Savage and his allies rush to stop Dr. Heinz Wessel's violent occupation of the World Trade Center, in a mad plot to fling the Earth's entire population into outer space.
name: Secret of the Twin Towers

description: A transmission regarding Niles' Operation Overcast is "intercepted" by the Doom Patrol and the team flies off to investigate, only to be met by the Operation's current meta-humans.
name: Natural Order

description:
Driq frees Harbinger from the Manhunters Prison. Firestorm and Captain Atom help them escape and underground cave. Firestorm is knocked unconscious when the cave collapses, and awakens to see Chief Ferguson kneeling next to him.

*** This issue is part of Millennium Week Five and shares scenes with Justice League International #10 ***

Firestorm826's Panel-by-Panel Story Summary (Spoiler Alert)

I have come with these strangers who know me - - the ones who call themselves the Justice League - - to attack the homeworld of they who call themselves Manhunters. I had thought these Manhunters had created me, but the silvery one called Captain Atom has shown me this is not so. He has taught me something of the nature of hero and I have chosen this path. But I still do not feel at ease among these ‚Äòheroes‚Äô. I don‚Äôt understand half of what they say. How can I be one of them?

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre planning our strategy, kid - - aren‚Äôt you coming?‚Äù Captain Atom asks. ‚ÄúFirestorm?‚Äù

Firestorm stands on the edge of an asteroid. Captain Atom is just behind him. Superman, Hawkman, Martian Manhunter, and Doctor Fate confer nearby. Arisia and Green Lantern hover above them. Hawkgirl and Katma Tui talk off to one side.

‚ÄúSomehting‚Äôs eating at him - - but I‚Äôll be damned if I know what!‚Äù Captain Atom thinks as Firestorm remains silent. ‚ÄúAh well - - I‚Äôm not here to babysit.‚Äù

Something explodes beneath the surface of the planet. ‚ÄúBut it couldn‚Äôt hurt to give it one more crack‚Ä¶‚Äù Captain Atom thinks. ‚ÄúC‚Äômon kid,‚Äù he calls to Firestorm. ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs the problem? You could at least give me the courtesy of a reply! A simple ‚ÄòStick it up your‚Ä¶‚Äù

Firestorm abruptly flies off without a word or a glance back. ‚ÄúHey!!!‚Äù Captain Atom yells.

‚ÄúNow what?‚Äù asks Martian Manhunter.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs what I‚Äôd like to know, J‚Äôonn,‚Äù Captain Atom replies.

I felt a cry for help.

‚ÄúI can get him back before he..,‚Äù Superman starts to say.

‚ÄúUh-uh, Superman,‚Äù Captain Atom interjects. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre needed here! I‚Äôll handle this! Besides - - Firestorm seems to have become my personal problem lately.‚Äù He leaps up in pursuit of Firestorm. ‚ÄúYou could almost say I‚Äôve grown fond of the kid. Almost,‚Äù he calls down.

‚ÄúBe careful, Captain Atom!‚Äù warns J‚Äôonn.

‚ÄúYes, mother!‚Äù Captain Atom replies.

‚ÄúSo much for the element of surprise,‚Äù worries Hawkman.

‚ÄúThis is par for the course for the League,‚Äù J‚Äôonn answers.

‚ÄúIt wasn‚Äôt in the old days,‚Äù Hawkman suggests.

‚ÄúIn case you haven‚Äôt noticed, Hawkman - - the old days are long gone!‚Äù J‚Äôonn explains.

Captain Atom races in pursuit behind Firestorm. ‚ÄúJust think - - I‚Äôve only been in this superhero game for a few short months - - and here I am, halfway across the galaxy, chasing this nuclear-headed adolescent with an attitude problem!‚Äù Captain Atom thinks as he flies. ‚ÄúMakes a guy wonder what‚Äôll happen next!‚Äù

Beneath the planet of the Manhunters‚Ä¶ ‚ÄúDrat!‚Äù frets Harbinger. ZZZZSCHRAKK! ZZZZZZZSCHRAK! Arcs of blue lightning streak around the rocky cave. She ducks and dodges out of the way, toeing her way carefully along a narrow network of catwalks above a lava flow.

RRRRRUMMMMBBBLLE! The cave shudders loudly. ‚ÄúWhen Driq rescued me from the Manhunters‚Äô Prison, I thought we could escape by going beneath the surface of the Manhunter planet!‚Äù Harbinger thinks. ‚ÄúBut this must be where they train all those murderous androids! It‚Äôs been one long battle to survive ever since we got here! I‚Äôve lost track of Driq and I‚Äôm beginning to think the Manhunter‚Äôs boast is fact! No one escapes the Manhunter‚Äôs planet!‚Äù

TZZZZIK! A huge blue disc rolls down the catwalk, coming right at her! RRRUMMBLE! ‚ÄúLooks like no one‚Äôs going to give me a hand - - except me!‚Äù Harbinger thinks as the disc closes in. ZAP! ZAP! ‚ÄúI‚Äôll create two duplicates of myself‚Ä¶and go on the counter-attack!‚Äù she thinks. Instantly, a duplicate appears on each side of her. SCHROK! SCHROK! The duplicates fire energy beams from their helmets into the disc.

‚ÄúAll together now! Let‚Äôs blast this sucker off the path!‚Äù Harbinger directs. SCHROK! The three Harbingers focus their energy beams and knock the disc away! SPLORSH! It falls and disappears into the lake of molten lava below. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs done! Now I‚Äôll just take a moment to collect myselves, then go find Driq and see if he‚Ä¶it‚Ä¶‚Äù

TZZZZSCHRAK! Another disc appears rolling quickly towards her! ‚ÄúYAH! Another one!‚Äù she blurts. ‚ÄúAnd I haven‚Äôt time to..!‚Äù

BUH-DOOOMMMM! The disc suddenly explodes into a cascade of jagged pieces! Harbinger covers her face with her arm to protect herself from the debris. ‚ÄúFfffnork!‚Äù Driq calls to her. He hovers above her with light gleaming from his green Power Ring.

‚ÄúDriq!‚Äù Harbinger calls to him. ‚ÄúThank heaven you showed up! Now I think we have a real hope of escaping!‚Äù

FWOMP! ‚ÄúGLURRRK!‚Äù Driq gasps as a massive nuclear burst smashes into him! He falls in flames to land on the catwalk just ahead of Harbinger.

‚ÄúHere. Problem is here,‚Äù Firestorm calls to Captain Atom as they fly close to Harbinger.

‚ÄúDriq!‚Äù Harbinger yells in shock. ‚ÄúYou imbeciles! What have you done to him!!‚Äù

‚ÄúWas he not‚Ä¶attacking you? From his form, I supposed...,‚Äù Firestorm answers confusedly.

‚ÄúFirestorm, I keep telling you you can‚Äôt go by appearance!‚Äù Captain Atom cautions him. ‚ÄúThat guy was, by his uniform, a Green Lantern, like those others you met! There‚Äôs quite a few of them and some of them look pretty weird.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Ä¶am sorry,‚Äù Firestorm says dejectedly.

‚ÄúSorry? You set fire to my friend and you say you‚Äôre sorry?‚Äù Harbinger asks, angrily pointing at Firestorm.

‚ÄúLighten up a little, lady! The Lantern‚Äôs Ring should protect him and the kid‚Äôs new at all this!‚Äù Captain Atom explains.

‚ÄúNew? Firestorm I know; you I don‚Äôt!‚Äù Harbinger replies.

‚ÄúI could say the same for you, ma‚Äôam!‚Äù Captain Atom tells her. He lands next to her on the catwalk. ‚ÄúFirestorm was reborn a few weeks ago and is still trying to sort everything out!‚Äù he explains.

SHHHHHHHHT! Driq‚Äôs Power Ring forms a gleaming silver fire extinguisher that sprays quickly to stop the flames. ‚ÄúWho are you and what are you doing down here?‚Äù Captain Atom asks.

‚ÄúThe name‚Äôs Harbinger and I was a prisoner of the Manhunters until Driq rescued me!‚Äù she explains. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs lucky for Driq you can‚Äôt really harm something that‚Äôs already dead!‚Äù

‚ÄúDead?!‚Äù Captain Atom asks in surprise.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs right,‚Äù Harbinger replies. ‚ÄúBut his Ring won‚Äôt let his spirit leave his body.‚Äù

Driq slowly gets to his feet as Firestorm lands on the catwalk next to him. ‚ÄúApologies, Driq Lantern,‚Äù Firestorm says, extending his hand.

‚ÄúAknpppt!‚Äù Driq replies. He shakes Firestorm‚Äôs hand. THULP! Driq‚Äôs fingers break off.

‚ÄúPermit me!‚Äù Firestorm says. He takes Driq‚Äôs arm in his hands and uses a transforming burst to reform Driq‚Äôs fingers.

‚ÄúTnnkuu!‚Äù Driq tells him.

‚ÄúCripes! He‚Äôs strange even for a Green Lantern!‚Äù Captain Atom observes.

‚ÄúHis deeds proclaim him a hero!‚Äù Harbinger explains. ‚ÄúAll I‚Äôve seen from you two so far is an irresponsible hot-head and a loud-mouthed chrome-plated nobody!‚Äù

‚ÄúWhat is it like‚Ä¶this ‚Äòdeath‚Äô?‚Äù Firestorm asks Driq.

‚ÄúGlarrrg!‚Äù Driq answers.

‚ÄúHm!‚Äù Firestorm replies.

‚ÄúFirestorm, what are you doing?‚Äù Captain Atom asks.

‚ÄúWhy, conversing with Driq Lantern,‚Äù Firestorm answers. He and Driq walk next to Captain Atom and Harbinger on the catwalk.

‚ÄúWell, stop it! He‚Äôs dead!‚Äù Captain Atom replies.

‚ÄúSo? That doesn‚Äôt mean he is not a nice person!‚Äù Firestorm tells him. Captain Atom smacks his forehead in frustration.

‚ÄúQuuuuurg?‚Äù asks Driq.

‚ÄúNo, Captain Atom does not dislike you, friend Driq,‚Äù Firestorm answers. ‚ÄúHe does not understand‚Ä¶‚Äù

RRRUMMBLE! ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs that?‚Äù Captain Atom asks.

‚ÄúTrouble!‚Äù Harbinger answers.

They stand at the intersection of four catwalks. TZZZIK! TZZZIK! RUMMMBLE! RUMMMBLE! Four discs rapidly spin towards them from each catwalk! ‚ÄúLarge, economy-sized trouble!‚Äù Harbinger adds.

‚ÄúQuuuurg!‚Äù blurts Driq.

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt be absurd! Why don‚Äôt we just fly up and away from them?‚Äù Captain Atom asks as he floats up off the catwalk.

TZZZZSCHRAK! An electrical blast shoots out and strikes Captain Atom! ‚Äú‚Ä¶That‚Äôs why!!!‚Äù Harbinger yells up to him.

ZAAAP! Captain Atom fires energy blasts into the walls. ‚ÄúFirestorm, can you make a detour?‚Äù he asks.

‚ÄúYes,‚Äù Firestorm answers. FZAAM! He beams two opposing discs to fly into the air above them. KA-BOOOMMM! The discs smash into each other and disintegrate.

‚ÄúThere‚Äôs more coming! We‚Äôve got to work together as a unit!‚Äù Captain Atom tells them. ‚ÄúGive them everything you‚Äôve got! And watch each other‚Äôs back!‚Äù SHAKOW! SHAKOW! He fires blasts into the approaching discs, shattering them.

FZAAM! ZAAP! FOOOSH! SCHROK! The four heroes blast away at oncoming discs. Suddenly‚Ä¶RUMBLE! RUMBLE! ‚ÄúAww, nooo!‚Äù cries Captain Atom. The cavern begins to collapse, raining rocks and boulders down.

‚ÄúThe battle! It‚Äôs torn apart the walls of the cavern!‚Äù Firestorm warns.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôve got to smash the rocks!‚Äù Captain Atom cautions.

ZAAP! FZAAM! SCHROK! ‚ÄúThat just breaks them into smaller rocks!‚Äù Harbinger cries out. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not stopping them!‚Äù

ROARRRR! The thundering wave of debris smashes through them, ripping the catwalks and sending the four heroes flying. ‚ÄúGAAAAAK!‚Äù yells Driq.

Blackness. Silence. Time passes.

‚ÄúFirestorm‚Ä¶?‚Äù a voice calls out from the void. ‚ÄúFirestorm? Can you hear me?‚Äù

Firestorm‚Äôs head moves slightly. He opens his eyes as consciousness returns. ‚ÄúFer-gus-on?!‚Äù he asks in surprise.

Chief Ferguson kneels next to him in a marshy area lined with large trees. ‚ÄúEasy, son,‚Äù Ferguson tells him. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôve had a hard time. Our enemies very nearly turned you against us by manipulating your mind. Fortunately for us, you‚Äôre stronger than they thought and not only broke free but brought us a new ally, Captain Atom.‚Äù

Firestorm props himself up on his elbows in the grass. Captain Atom stands behind him with two Manhunters. ‚ÄúWhere‚Ä¶Where are we?‚Äù Firestorm asks.

‚ÄúLook around,‚Äù Ferguson answers.

‚ÄúThe‚Ä¶Sonic Temple on Earth,‚Äù Firestorm says as he scans the area. ‚ÄúNo. It blew up. We contained the blast. The Captain and I talked. He convinced me. He went into space with others to‚Ä¶to‚Ä¶‚Äù

‚ÄúIt was all a delusion, Firestorm,‚Äù Ferguson explains.

Captain Atom and the two Manhunters walk over. ‚ÄúTry to remember,‚Äù Captain Atom tells Firestorm. ‚ÄúYou and I talked. You convinced me to join the Manhunters. You were captured. Our enemies tried to manipulate your mind and make you destroy the Temple. Here on Earth.‚Äù

‚ÄúDriq? Har-bing-er‚Ä¶‚Äù Firestorm asks slowly.

‚ÄúDelusions created by the enemy,‚Äù Captain Atom explains.

RRRUMMMBBLE! Earth tremors shake the area, jostling the group with its unsteady ripples. ‚ÄúThat was also created by our enemy,‚Äù Chief Ferguson says. ‚ÄúThey‚Äôre so determined to destroy us they would blow up the planet as well. Firestorm, only you and Captain Atom have enough power to stop them. It‚Äôs kill or be killed time, kid. Our survival‚Äôs at stake.‚Äù

‚ÄúKill‚Ä¶?‚Äù Firestorm asks confusedly.

‚ÄúLook, I don‚Äôt like it, either,‚Äù Captain Atom answers. ‚ÄúBut if we‚Äôre willing to sacrifice our own lives to protect what we hold dear, it only makes sense we‚Äôre willing to sacrifice their lives!‚Äù

‚ÄúNo. To make another die for my cause is not right,‚Äù Firestorm replies. ‚ÄúThey have their own causes and a right to their own lives.‚Äù

‚ÄúFine. Let‚Äôs help them die for their own cause,‚Äù Captain Atom suggests. ‚ÄúLook. Trust me on this one, okay?‚Äù

‚ÄúDo as you think right. I shall,‚Äù Firestorm answers.

‚ÄúWho do you think you are..?!‚Äù Captain Atom asks.

‚ÄúI am Firestorm. You‚Ä¶are not the Captain Atom. The true Captain Atom told me to look past appearances. The true Captain Atom would not speak as you do,‚Äù Firestorm answers. ‚ÄúTherefore, you are a lie. Therefore, this all is a lie.‚Äù

FASHHHHHHHHHHHHH! The marshy landscape slowly disappears, replaced by yellow-walled room with geometric shapes lining its surfaces. ‚ÄúThe truth is, then, is you are all Manhunters. And I am still on your planet,‚Äù Firestorm says as he looks around at seven Manhunters surrounding him.

‚ÄúAnd no man escapes the Manhunters!‚Äù explains one with Ferguson‚Äôs head atop his red and blue uniform. Each carries a gold rod in their hand like a weapon.

‚ÄúI have not come to escape,‚Äù Firestorm replies. ‚ÄúBut to end.‚Äù FWOOSH! FWOOSH! He fires bursts into two of the Manhunters, wrapping them in nuclear fire and leaps into the air.

ZAM! The Ferguson replica fires his rod‚Ä¶SCHRAK! It inadvertently strikes another Manhunter! ZAM! A Manhunter fires, but Firestorm swoops out of the way. FZAAM! Firestorm reforms the Ferguson replica‚Äôs rod, bending it at a sharp angle just as it fires. The burst hits another Manhunter nearby! FWOOOSH! Firestorm aims blasts with both hands that smash into five Manhunters, knocking them away.

RRRUMMMBBBLLE! ‚ÄúFirestorm, listen to me!‚Äù the Ferguson replica tells him. ‚ÄúThere isn‚Äôt much time! The planet is being destroyed! We know your secrets! Things you don‚Äôt know yourself! Are you aware that you are the melding of two other beings? Side with us and we‚Äôll reveal all your mysteries to you!‚Äù

‚ÄúNo,‚Äù Firestorm answers. ‚ÄúYou are corrupt beings. You twist what you touch. Even the truth.‚Äù

‚ÄúOne way or another, you will serve us!‚Äù yells pseudo-Ferguson. ZAAP! A beam of energy shoots out of his forehead. Firestorm leaps just in time to dodge it, soaring above his opponent.

‚ÄúI serve the cause of life!‚Äù Firestorm yells. FZAAP! FWORSH! A blast of water smashes down onto pseudo-Ferguson. ‚ÄúYou are unlife!‚Äù Firestorm yells as the water hits. ‚ÄúBut in his lies there was a glimmer of truth, and that truth I must have!‚Äù Firestorm thinks. ‚ÄúThe voices I senses within me‚Ä¶they must be the beings of which the liar spoke, voices that have been stilled‚Ä¶‚Äù

Firestorm sees a mental image of two separate bodies merging into one. ‚Äú‚Ä¶Voices‚Ä¶I see you‚Ä¶I sense you‚Ä¶and what you are, you who are me!‚Äù he thinks. ‚ÄúI‚Ä¶understand how you are me! I feel your fear and frustration! I will free you for you must be free! In turn, you must stay joined with me for now‚Ä¶so we may aid others! And then I will surrender myself back to you! Will you do this?‚Äù

‚Äú‚Ä¶Yes‚Ä¶‚Äù answers the merged being in his mind.

‚ÄúThen be free‚Ä¶and remember!‚Äù Firestorm answers. SCHRAK! In Firestorm‚Äôs mind‚Äôs eye, he sees the images of Ronnie Raymond and Mikhail Arkadin take shape.

‚ÄúFirestorm!!!‚Äù a voice yells suddenly.

‚ÄúWho‚Ä¶?!‚Äù Firestorm blurts, looking around quickly.

‚ÄúRelax, kid; it‚Äôs us!‚Äù calls out Captain Atom as he flies into the room with Driq and Harbinger. ‚ÄúDriq managed to whip up a shield that saved us, but you were stunned and wandered away,‚Äù Captain Atom explains. ‚ÄúIf you‚Äôre okay now, we‚Äôd better get out of here! It seems like the entire planet is shaking itself apart!‚Äù

‚ÄúYes. Let us go‚Ä¶‚Äù Firestorm answers, cautiously eyeing them.

‚ÄúEveryone together!‚Äù Captain Atom yells, leading them upwards. ‚ÄúWith luck, our combined power will be enough to break us out to the surface!‚Äù They soar upwards, reaching the top, then‚Ä¶

‚ÄúNOW!!!‚Äù Captain Atom yells. The four heroes focus their combined energy into the rock overhead until‚Ä¶THA-KOOOOMMM! RUMMMBLE! BOOMMM! SHA-DOOOMMM! The roof collapses and the four heroes shoot out into space!

In the heavens above, we find our‚Ä¶.comrades. Our friends. Perhaps‚Ä¶my friends. I watch the planet come apart, as would I if I did not concentrate. All around me, the others laugh and jest and make idle chatter. It is good to be with them. There is more to me‚Ä¶to my life‚Ä¶than I had imagined. But not more than I can imagine. This‚Ä¶existence - - this life - - begins to make sense to me, at last. It is a wonderful thing - - this life I have. I shall strive to be worthy of it. I cannot wait to see what happens next.
name: Planetfall

description:
Wally West discusses his father's revelation with his therapist in Manhattan when suddenly a rotund man known as Chunk robs the diamond exchange across the street. The Flash speeds to the rescue, but Chunk has some tricks the speedster might not be prepared for!

When Wally starts seeing a therapist due to Tina they talk about his problems with his father.He tells him his father was a manhunter.A terrified women comes in screaming.She informs them a man is raiding the jewelry store. Wally speeds out and dons his attire before anybody sees. He finds an enormous man with a gun pointing it at the manager. He Flash rushes over to the man referred to as Chunk. After engaging the man Flash wakes up after being knocked unconscious. He charges into the hall and Chink has vanished. Flash decides to go home. He‚Äôs disappointed. When he reaches his destination he finds police at his home. His mom has cooked dinner and she has gotten into a fight with Tina. Next, Chunk robs another bank and disappears again. Just a big flash and he‚Äôs gone. Another robbery by Chunk and Wally gets there faster than the speed of light. When he gets there he gets into a dispute with Chunk. Wally starts the brawl off. After a few minutes Chunk shows him how he keeps disappearing. And soon after Wally‚Äôs gone too.
name: The Chunk

description:
Many years have passed, and the Flower Children of New Genesis are back to battle the deadly forces‚Ä¶an evil that threatens to corrupt the very soul of humanity!

This issue follows the story of The Forever People, It acts as an overview of There travels, successes and losses of the Group.

The Stroy starts off with a key Member Sarifan, Telling us his version of events, of the time they went to earth. He tells us the history of The Forever People, before Proceeding with his tale.

Originated at a place called Supertown consisting of Five founding members. *Beautiful Dreamer Big Bear Serifan Vykin Mark Moonrider Other honorary members include Infinity Man motherbox

Genesis

The leader of The Forever People is Mark Moonrider. He first formed the Forever People in a town called Supertown. Or New-Genesis, as the "stiffs" like to call it. It was a land beyond dreams, with unbelievable sights and colorful imagery, it was said to be a place as magical as Narnia, Wonderland and Neverland all rolled into one. It was a place reminiscent of The Garden of Eden. Peace and happiness throughout. Though always happy The Forever People become tired, bored and restless. They longed for adventure.

Moto

Mark had a goal that was to enlighten the world, to increase small uneducated nations, into super intelligent Beings.

"Alone we were dreamers, but together we were the dream itself. just beyond infinity's edge lies The Barrier. Its existence is known by few-- And they Guard The Secret Jealousy. For what lies beyond the barrier is forever, and forever, can be a dangerous place"

The day after Forever

The Forever People set off on a journey into the unknown. After not so long they crashed landed on earth. They lived there for roughly 6months to a year. A Place called Adon. They came across the natives after about a month, this was back when earth was an uneducated place and everyone was innocent, not scared by war and knowledge. It was an exotic place, the forest was vast, the earth was green all over. The Forever people were welcomed in by the innocent child like species. Then Mark Moonrider decided to push his plan forward. This was to be the downfall of The Forever People,,,,

Mother Box

The Forever People, are an extremely evolved civilization, The invented a Team member/computer called the Mother Box. The power of the Mother Box is forever. Its capability's are to alter brainwaves to increase the speed of evolution, It showed the brain the travels and knowledge that The Forever People have endured. Mark became power mad and almost forced the natives of Adon to undergo the Techno Psychic Surgery. Earthlings were perfect shells for Mark. After an unimaginable amount of surgery had taken place, Mother Box exploded and killed Loyal member Vykin.

Darkseid

While on Earth the Forever People disrupted the evil plans of Darkseid. This was not the kind of attention Mark wanted, During there visit Beautiful Dreamer was kidnapped, Mark was not impressed. Due to the Fact they had stumbled across an intergalactic war. New-Genesis and Apokolis Had got themselves into a war while they were vacant from supertown, Mark blamed Sarifan for the situation they were in. They had to rescue Dreamer. Darkseid was the leader of the Apokolis. He was about to test the Non-Violent Group to there fullest.

The war

The war was the fault of a maniac partner of Darkseid known as Devilance, They both partnered up to destroy the peaceful place of New Genesis, they waged war on all that was peaceful, and earth was where he chose his HQ.

Nowhereland

During there rescue mission of Beautiful Dreamer, A Hero called infinity man, an honorary member of the Forever People, came to lend the somewhat innocent Group a hand. Infinity man and Devilance Clashed in a furious battle, both blew up and vanished, just before this battle Infinity man saved all of The Forever People from certain danger including Beautiful Dreamer, but instead of teleporting them to a safe haven, they all became Trapped in between cosmic barriers known as Nowhereland.

Where Are They Now

The Forever People are scattered around the cosmos, most playing vital roles in keeping the cosmos, especially Supertown. Mark Moonrider is the New Mayor of Supertown, Big Bear and Beautiful Dreamer are now happily married. One Member has changed Dramatically since there time on Earth. Sarifan has been left bitter and twisted by the Death of his good friend Vykin. Mark is who he blames for the Tragedy. He Remains in a manic state, and is powered by darkness to seek revenge on Moonrider.....

The Story ends with Serifan/Sarifan Returning From Nowhereland, where he was abandoned by Mark Moonrider without the Knowledge of The Forever People, A mysterious Creature called "The dark" Releases him from his prison. He Then Proceeds to Supertown. Meanwhile The remaining Members of The Forever People, are attending a party, hosted by Mark Moonrider, the new mayor of Supertown/New Genesis.

As Serifan Approaches on the back of the creature known as Dark. The Story Ends..........
name: Return to Forever

description:
Notes:

  • "Read this week's issue of Millennium before reading this book"
name: Diversions!

description:
After having been forced to run from the demon Mnemoth, because he is not a strong enough demon to handle it alone, John Constantine returns to the Midnight Club to beg Papa Midnite for help. He searches through the club's rooms filled with debauchery, down to the basement, where the arena is. Midnite justifies the violence of his arena show by having the contestants be mere zombies, but John is still put out - particularly by the spatter of blood on his face.

In the meantime, Papa Midnite has put Gary Lester into his holding pens, thinking him nothing more than bait for the demon. John finds that the more Gaz pleads for a drug fix, the easier it is to lie to him and detach. Gary is naturally unhappy with the arrangement to come, and worries that the demon will destroy him. John tries to ignore his pathetic old friend as Papa Midnite guides him away, warning that they will begin fighting the demon in the morning.

That night, after peeling off his stale clothes, John is haunted by images of his friends, killed during his attempts to fight the Brujeria and their Invunche. He tries to fight his feelings of fear by getting angry, and he turns to the ghost of Emma, demanding to know the meaning of the haunting. Frustrated, he tries apologizing for the fact that they were all killed on his watch, but his thoughts turn to Gary, and he supposes that they intend to make him feel guilty for what's to happen to him. Grumpily, John crawls into bed and shouts that if there is any guilt, it is his, and he will deal with it. Then, he tells the ghosts to sod off. They vanish, but as he is falling asleep, John hears Emma's voice wishing him goodnight, and he bursts into tears.

Meanwhile, Mnemoth's plague of hunger continues to infect the citizens of New York City. One victim begins devouring a pile of comic books, while another man satisfies his undying hunger by chewing off his own arm. Another man breaks into a jewelry store and begins voraciously shoving gemstones into his mouth. The city is in chaos. The demon continues, and is suddenly drawn to the pain inside Gary Lester - the hunger already inside him, and his craving for junk.

The following morning, John is roused from bed by one of Midnite's zombies. Up on the top floor of the Midnight Club, Papa Midnite is unimpressed by John's attempts at facile humour, and urges him to get down to business. John, however, is quite impressed by the electric chair that Papa Midnite acquired at acution from Sing Sing. 300 lives have gone to their ends at that chair, and that has imbued it with a powerful magic that they can use. Before beginning, John attempts to calm his old friend. It has little effect, so John bribes Gaz with a syringe of heroine.

As Midnite begins preparing for the binding, Gaz spies the cloud of insects on the horizon. Midnite kills a chicken and pours the blood out in a circle around Gary, who frantically warns John that he will never be able to trap the demon in a bottle, as its too big. John says nothing, and it doesn't take long before Gaz realizes that they don't have a bottle. He is to be the vessel in which the demon is bound. The only place they can catch the demon is in a place it wants to go - and that is Gary Lester.

John watches as his old friend is enveloped in the demon's cloud of insects, and they all pour into his every orifice. Quickly, John struggles to tattoo the binding symbols onto Gaz' skin before the demon escapes again. Suddenly, Gary wakes and rips free of the chair. he begins attempting to strangle John, but the Englishman manages to talk him out of it. He and Midnite wrap Gaz in a strait-jacket, knowing that in order to destroy the demon, Gaz and Mnemoth must devour eachother. Mercifully, John gives his friend the heroine fix he craved, attempting to be comforting in some respect. Kissing Gaz on the forehead, John calls for whisky and cigarettes, and heads downstairs as the demon begins to feed.

John drinks and smokes himself into a stupor, listening to Gaz' screams reverberate through the Midnight Club. Before passing out, he catches a glimpse of the ghosts that haunt him tending to the Gaz' corpse. John is not welcome. With Gaz dead at last, Midnite orders the holding pen bricked up.

As Constantine leaves the club, he sees Gary Lester's spirit join with those of his former comrades.

-Source
name: A Feast Of Friends

description:
1. Cover by Vince Argondezzi.
  2. Written by Roy and Dann Thomas, penciled by Vince Argondezzi, inked by Tony DeZuniga, colored by Liz Berube and lettered by Jean Simek.
name: Outback and Back in Beverly Hills

description:
With half the Legion gone, the 30th century's remaining heroes realize they can't safeguard the galaxy alone, so (you knew this was coming)...it's time once again for the Legionnaire Try-Outs! An open audition means that Legion HQ is overrun with prospective applicants, many of them possessing more "personality" than actual ability. But by issue's end, several new Legionnaires are inducted to carry on the team's heroic tradition!

  1. Cover by Steve Lightle.
  2. Written by Paul Levitz, penciled by Greg LaRocque, inked by Mike DeCarlo and Arne Starr, colored by Carl Gafford and lettered by John Costanza.

The Legion of Super-Heroes continue to battle against Laurel Kent, a Manhunter. She self-detonates after the battle is over, feeling that her purpose is over.
name: ...And Wake to Find a Dream

description: When three separate super villains (the Gentleman Ghost, I.Q., and Silver Fog) all show up planning to steal the same diamond, a super villain free-for-all ensues, with the Teen Titans stuck in the middle!
name: Round Holes & Square Pegs

description:
Final issue. Millennium Week 5. The team returns to Looker's "birthplace," only to encounter the Manhunters in "...A Land Down Under..."

  1. Cover by Erik Larsen and Al Gordon.
  2. "...A Land Down Under..." written by Mike W. Barr, penciled by Erik Larsen, inked by Mark Farmer, colored by Adrienne Roy and lettered by Albert De Guzman.
name: ...A Land Down Under...

description:
A terrorist organization closes in on the Peacemaker.

Notes:

  • Wolfgang Schmidt appears as an imagination of Christopher Smith.
  • Three page text piece designated as an Official Report by Phillip Kramer to Harry Stein which contains the history of Christopher Smith.
name: The Wages of Tzin!

description: The Question is on the trail of a group of paramilitary fanatics but gets captured in the process; guest-starring Aristotle Rodor, Myra Fermin, Colonel DeBeck, and Crew.
name: Be All That You Can Be...

description:
1. Cover by Stephen Bissette and Ed Hannigan.
  2. "The Secret Origin of the Guardians of the Universe" written by Todd Klein, penciled by Jonathan Peterson, inked by Al Vey, colored by Carl Gafford and lettered by Agustin Mas.
  3. "Shine on You Crazy Diamond" written by Rick Veitch, penciled and inked by Brett Ewing, colored by Shelley Eiber and lettered by Agustin Mas.
  4. "Secrets Behind the Origins" 1/2 page text piece on the histories of the Guardians of the Universe and the Floronic Man by Peter Sanderson.
  5. "And Now in Answer to Many Requests Dept.:" 1 page text piece featuring the first appearances of well known and obscure Golden Age characters and teams in chronological order by Roy Thomas.

Note: Most characters have cameo appearances.

The Secret Origin of the Guardians of the Universe: The Guardian Herupa Hando Hu and the Zamaron Nadia Safir, tell the New Guardians the story of how the Guardians of the Universe came to be.

Shine on you Crazy Diamond: Killer Croc while locked up in Arkham befriends Floronic Man, who tells Croc stories while he heals from his latest battle with the Batman. The story Floronic Man tells is a fantasy story about how John Woodrue became the Floronic Man. The story is capped off by Floronic mysterious escape, and Croc ability to heal quicker then the guards can expect.
name: The Secret Origin of The Guardians of the Universe / Shine On You Crazy Diamond

description:
"The Secret Executioners"

. LCIs transport Easy Company to a beach assault as the Allies prepare to liberate Italy. Once safely past the beach Easy works to clear a series of hills needed for the Allied advance. But they encounter a group of American and German thieves working together for black market profit. It will take the most unlikely of alliances to track down this group who is killing both Americans and Germans.
name: The Secret Executioners
Halfway to Hyde on the Nulloid Express
Battle Of The Bands

description:
1. Cover by Jerry Bingham.
  2. "Housewarming Party" written by Doug Moench, penciled and inked by Gray Morrow, colored by Adrienne Roy and lettered by Agustin Mas.

Notes:

  • On page 7 panel 3 the lady is wearing a Batman (Bat Symbol) necklace.
  • Kim bought a bag of "Moenches" a reference to the writer of the story Doug Moench.
name: Housewarming Party

description: A cadet with command of the U.S.S. Cluster applies all the wrong lessons from Kirk's career in "Idol Threats".
name: Idol Threats
Where No One Has Gone Before

description:
It's Batman versus Amanda Waller as the Dark Knight discovers the existence of the Suicide Squad and doesn't take too well to the idea!

Batman infiltrated Belle Reve to confirm if the Suicide Squad is real. After confronting Amanda Waller, telling her that he will blow the whistle on the covert government team, Batman seems like he has the upper hand. However, Amanda Waller informs Batman that she will use all of her extensive resources to find out who Batman really is and report that to the media as well. Feeling stymied, Batman reluctantly agrees to keep the Suicide Squad a secret until he can find another way to take them down.
name: Up Against the Wall

description:
Millennium: Week 6. "Last Stand!" Guest-starring Green Lantern (Hal Jordan). Two of Earth's greatest champions, Superman and Green Lantern, have traveled to the far side of the universe in search of the missing Guardians. What they find is the most powerful Manhunter of all, the Manhunter Highmaster! Can even the Man of Steel and the greatest Green Lantern of all stand against such an awesome power?

Notes:

  • Most characters have cameo flashback appearances.
  • Story continues in Millennium #7.
name: Last Stand!

description: Swamp Thing struggles internally with his identity and his future. Meanwhile, strange occurrences begin as the seed for the new Swamp Thing goes missing.
name: Wild Thing

description: Reprint of The New Teen Titans #26
name: Twister Shout

description:
Adrian Chase reminisces about all of the things that have brought him to this moment. He gets into an argument with Black Thorn in his apartment and backhands her across the face.

He goes out and takes in a movie to clear his head. During the show, a group of rowdy teenagers irritates him and he attacks them. Police raid the theater during the fight, but Adrian fights them off and escapes custody.

Black Thorn meets with Harry Stein in a diner to discuss Adrian's declining mental health. Harry has no idea where Chase is, and tells Thorn to calm down.

Adrian dons his Vigilante disguise and raids an opium den. The police track his movements and raid the house seconds after the Vigilante slaughters everyone in the room. Captain Hall gives chase and gets the drop on Chase. Surprised, Adrian instinctively fires upon Captain Hall, and accidentally kills him.

Burdened by the weight of his own sins, Adrian Chase can no longer endure the guilt of the lives he has taken. Alone and despondent, he returns to his apartment, loads his magnum and takes his own life.

A small funeral service is held, and Black Thorn takes possession of the urn containing Adrian's ashes.
name: A Life
The Queen Is Dead!...Long Live The Queen!

description:
1. Cover by John Byrne and Walt Simonson.
  2. "History Lesson" written by John Byrne, penciled by Mike Mignola, inked by Rick Bryant, colored by Petra Scotese and lettered by John Workman and Typeset.

Jor-El reviews the history tapes of his ancestor Van-L in the final battle against the group Black Zero a thousand centuries ago. Kan-Z is revealed to be the leader of Black Zero intent on destroying the planet. Van-L apparently stops the process of destruction, but Vara is killed in the process. Jor-El is chosen to marry Lara and have a child to fill a vacancy on the register of citizens.
name: History Lesson

description:
1. Cover by Brian Murray.
  2. "...You have nothing to lose but your Souls!" written by Roy and Dann Thomas, penciled by Brian Murray, inked by Malcolm Jones III, colored by Gene D'Angelo and lettered by Jean Simek.

Notes:

  • Millennium Week 6 crossover.
  • Maria the grandmother of Celia Windward (Jet) life was saved by Alan Scott.
  • Katy Kalmaku mother of Tom Kalmaku and Shigeru Yakata the father of Takeo Yakata (Ram) have a cameo appearance.

Green Lantern's mission is finally made clear after saving a woman somewhere west of Jamaica. Scott has to face-off against Baron Blitzkrieg. The Spirit of the Green Flame reveals it was controlling Scott's actions. The three people Scott saved would be the ancestors of three of the New Guardians.
name: ...You have nothing to lose but your Souls!

deck: The year is 2032. Corruption, prostitution, and cameras are everywhere; from the top of what's left of the American government to the bottom of the sleaziest pit imaginable. When former vid star Reuben Flagg is drafted into the Plexus Rangers, he's sent to Chicago, a cesspool of gang violence, dirty politics and urban warfare. It's enough to crush an ordinary man but Reuben is a survivor and with the help of his new friends, he just might be the man to put it all back together.
description: Reuben exposes The Old Ranger's plot to harvest black market organs to extend the lives of himself and other key members of Plexcorp. The Merry Pranksters get involved and a fight ensues on the Earth/Mars shuttle. With Raul recording everything live from the Q-USA station, Reuben decides to use the old ranger's security clearance to confront The President of the United States.
name: Sometimes A Great Notion Goes Awry Part 3

story_arc_credits.name: Sometimes A Great Notion Goes Awry

first_appearance_storyarcs.name: Sometimes A Great Notion Goes Awry

description: The conclusion to Grand Master.
name: Showdown in the South China Sea

description: The trail of the Merchants of Menace leads Captain Thunder and Blue Bolt to Scotland and a battle with the wheel of doom.
name: Maximum Bad

description: Sasquatch is having trouble coming to terms with his identity, since he is now in a woman's body. He goes outside to let himself think, in the form of Sasquatch, while Purple Girl and Laura Dean speak and try to come to a better understanding. Sasquatch, while outside, comes across Tundra and his fellow Great Beasts and they try to convince Sasquatch that he is still a Great Beast and demands that he joins their fold. Alpha Flight fights against the Great Beasts and are able to win, though it appears as if it has taken the Alphans lives.
name: Identity Crisis!

description: Dr. Octopus has busted out of the mental hospital to destroy Spider-Man once and for all- by nuking New York City! The Doctor figures he's bound to kill his fearsome foe for sure that way!
name: I'll Take Manhattan

description: As the Avengers prepare to move to their new headquarters, Machine Man and the Super-Adaptoid resurrect the Kree's Sinister Sentry and the mutant-hunting Tess One to join their robot army! Can even the Avengers win out over this mighty mechanical threat?
name: Heavy Metal!

description: The new Captain America and Bucky are after the villainous Professor Power - and the villain may not survive the arrest! Meanwhile, the aptain and his allies are in jail - for helping the police fight the all-new Serpent Society!
name: Power Struggle

description: Scuzz forms his own gang made up of the younger residents at The Clinic. As the paranormals continue to form their cliques, can a gang war be far behind?
name: Rumble

description: Cosmic rays have turned Ms. Marvel into‚Ä¶a Thing! And they've turned Thing into‚Ä¶even MORE of a Thing! How will they deal with their new mutations? Perhaps they'll need the help of an old friend- Black Panther!
name: I Want To Die!

description:
After the Hulk accidentally destroys a plane, Wolverine is out to make him pay for his mistake. It's Wolverine vs. the Hulk!

Classic storyline of Wolverine versus Gray Hulk with an even more classic cover.

Notes:

  • Ranked #32 in Wizard Magazine's list of "100 Best Single Issue Comics Since You Were Born".
name: Vicious Circle

concept_credits.name: 100 Best Single Issue Comics Since You Were Born

first_appearance_concepts.name: 100 Best Single Issue Comics Since You Were Born

description:
At a public auction, Beetle is threatening the auctioneer to hand over the Picasso painting or he'll kill him. Iron Man is there to subdue Beetle and leaves him for the police to handle. Iron Man heads for Tony Stark's house and goes inside.

Rhodey meets up with Tony Stark in his lab and delivers some smuggled cargo. As they're unpacking Tony gets a phone call from Hawkeye and Mockingbird. They're concerned that Tony fired Iron Man from Stark Enterprises and that he is still going "vigilante" on the suspects who he believes have stolen his armor technology. He tells them not to worry and hangs up the phone.

Stark walks upstairs and heads for his office. He is again swarmed with employees asking questions, and giving advice. He passes them all and just about before he's going to walk inside his office, Mrs. Arbogast advises him that he has people waiting in his office. Not remembering he has any appointments he goes inside. Inside his office he is met by Col. Nick Fury of S.H.I.E.L.D. and they begin talking.

S.H.I.E.L.D. is concerned about Iron Man and his current condition. They are upset that Iron Man has hurt a federal agent (Stingray) and want him brought to justice. Tony Stark cooperates and feeds them a false lead and agrees to help them find Iron Man. They agree to set up a base of operations at Stark Enterprise building in New York, they leave.

In New York, the begin investigating the whereabouts of Iron Man. Tony gives them a false lead to some property he's recently reacquired and recommends they send in the Mandriods. Col Fury agrees but adds 100 ground troops.

The next morning, as planned, Col Fury sends in the troops and Mandroids. Iron Man is ready for them and has set up preliminary mines which disable any robotic armor in the area. He is able to disable two of the 5 on the first wave. Col Fury orders them to charge. Two charge at Iron Man and he's able to absorb the energy of one enough to lower it's shields and plant an explosive. Then he uses the stored energy of the now disabled to wear down the shields of the next. He then plans another detonator on the 4th and renders him useless.

Now there's only one left who's pilot ejects and escapes. Tony destroys the last of the armor while pushing the unarmored troops back with a sonic blast. He escapes into the night.

Back at Start Enterprises Col Fury questions Tony's loyalty because it seems like Iron Man knew they were coming. Tony blames it on S.H.I.E.L.D. technology and plants a bug proving that Iron Man was able to infiltrate and discover their plans beforehand.
name: The Last Mandroid

description:
* Fall of the Mutants crossover *

When NYC is hit by a blackout during the Fall of the Mutants storyline, Katie decides to descend into the subway system to try to rescue her mother. Alex, Julie and Jack, who are still grounded from their exploits in issue #33, decide to follow her to make sure she is safe.

Katie finds Pestilence, one of the Four Horsemen, attacking commuters on a subway train. She draws the villain's attention away from the subway and back upstairs, but becomes ill when Pestilence touches her. She manages to find her siblings, and by working together, they access their Kymellian healing powers and cure themselves of Pestilence's sickness.

The kids assist Cyclops and Jean Grey in saving people around the city and tracking Pestilence. During their final battle, Julie knocks Pestilence off her horse with the "Julie Hammer" technique. Katie attempts to save the villain, but she is unable to do so when a piece of falling debris hits Pestilence and crushes her. Jean Grey consoles Katie.

The kids return to their apartment before their mother returns home. Katie confesses that she forced the other kids to break their grounding because she left the house. Margaret Power tells her that she is glad that her siblings had the good sense to go after her, and nobody is in trouble.
name: Life or Death!

description:
While sleeping in a warehouse in a area that was supposed to be vacant, Castle hears the sound of a garbage truck. It sounds suspicious to him so he checks it out, only to discover that it was full of dead bodies. The driver was nowhere to be found.

The Punisher goes to Microchip and his son to get information about who the truck might belong to. Microchip Jr discovers that it belongs to a corporation. Frank infuriates the headquarters and knocks out their guard dogs with tranquilizer darts. He eavesdrops on a conversation by two of the people that work their and overhears that they disregard their vile belongings in a pit. The Punisher is spotted by one of the men, but he kills him, throwing a knife at him stabbing him in the throat. The next man attacks Castle with a machine gun, but Frank flanks him and shoots him.

Frank searches the building and finds lots of cash and a black book full of their pick up places. The phone rings and Castle answers it and hears about a pick up that night. After visiting Microchip Jr and giving him the locations of the pick ups he goes to the spot that was given over the phone. He parks his van in the distance and goes to the location on foot. He crosses a dump full of radioactive material that also seemed like the spot where they were disposing of bodies.

When the Punisher gets to the meeting point he finds out that the mob is selling plutonium to Arabian terrorists. He breaks up the meeting and a fire fight ensues. Frank finds a weapons cache and takes ammo and grenades and makes it out of the building. He is outnumbered fifteen to one. He finds onc of them alone and captures him for questioning. He reveals that the Arabs are making a bomb with the plutonium. Frank goes back to the weapons cache and takes a grenade launcher and uses it to blow up the armory. The issues ends with the mobs reinforcements showing up.
name: Garbage

description: Groo uses the amulet to give his friends everything he thinks they want.
name: Rhyme nor Reason

description:
Absorbed into the hive mind of the Supreme Intelligence, Silver Surfer sees a reality never destined to be. Love, companionship, the blissfulness of peace- will Norrin Radd ever experience these things again? Back on Zenn-La, Shalla Bal‚Äôs in dire straits‚Ä¶and Mantis is nowhere to be found!

Silver Surfer is trapped inside the mind of Supreme Intelligence causing him to think improperly. The Surfer views this as a nonsensical world.

Nenora contacts the Skrull command to inform them of the situation. Kylor tells her to steal the soul gem. She says his guard will not drop enough to do so but the conversation is cut short when a Kree approaches. It is Master Pap-Tonn who is experimenting with the Surfer's board but it seems impervious to their tests.

Surfer is still wandering Supreme Intelligence's mind where things are almost seeming to make sense. He somehow gets the message that Mantis has been captured by the Elders. He is greeted by Contemplator in his astral form.

Contemplator tells Supreme Intelligence that Surfer's soul is free inside of him. Supreme Intelligence says that it is of yet unassimilated and that it will be. In his mind he controls the Kree to attack the Surfer and assimilate him. A silver dog assists Surfer reminding him he is not alone. Surfer begins to regain his identity and fight back, but without his Power Cosmic.

Meanwhile, Shalla Bal wonders about Mantis as she realizes that Surfer didn't leave her but that she pushed him away. She uses her Power Cosmic to try to contact Mantis.

Surfer meanwhile realizes he is in some type of dream that is mixed with others dreams. He is now greeted by a silver falcon. They are attacked by Supreme Intelligence in the form of an octopus dragon. The Surfer manages to call his board from the lab which flies into the Soul Gem on Supreme Intelligence's forehead. With his board Silver Surfer escapes Supreme Intelligence's mind and takes the Soul Gem for himself. This causs the mind of the Supreme Intelligence to come apart.

Shalla Bal finally receives an answer from the message she sent to Mantis but not by who she expects.....The Gardener.
name: Soul, Sweet Soul

description: When Trickshot lures Hawkeye to Paris, the Avengers' age archer finds himself facing Batroc the Leaper, Machete, and Zaran the Weapons Master, better known as Batroc's Brigade! Also: Moon Knight battles the ebon-cloaked Shroud! But which one is Marvel's true master of darkness?
name: An American Archer in Paris/Tower of Shadows
Mr. Jip, Usurper Of Souls / This Earth, This Realm

description:
PETER B. GILLIS (W) ‚Ä¢ BRENT ANDERSON (A)

They were transformed into Earth's greatest heroes - knowing that they would die within twelve months as a fatal side-effect. Now one of the Morituri, Radian, has a chance to find a cure for the terminal consequences. But his quest for that cure may cut the lives of hiss teammates even shorter when he leads them into a trap set by a band of super-powered alien Hordians!
name: ...That is the Question

description: The Mighty Thor battles Exitar the Celestial on the planet Pangoria. Thor fights to try and prevent the planet's destruction.
name: Alone Against The Celestials

description:
Peter is swinging across the city to go to his first day as substitute teacher as a favour to the principal at Forest Hills. When he arrives, he breaks up a fight between a jock (Jake) and geek (Steve). It reminds him of himself and Flash back in high school.

Meanwhile, in a South American country, Captain Alvarez is in charge of military ethnic cleansing.

Back in the US and Steve shows Pete a lab he has set up in the school's basement. There are lots of computers that have been provided by his Dad, who works for ICM (heh). Pete tells Steve he should mix more with other students but Steve storms off and gets into another fight with Jake.

After breaking them up again, Pete goes back to the lab when a robot smashes through the door controlled by ‚Ä¶ THE LIVING BRAIN! This brings back memories (check ASM8).

Steve is controlling it and sends the robot after Jake. It overturns a car and is choking Jake when Spidey swings in. After a lengthy battle, Spider-Man comes out on top.

Back in South America and Captain Alvarez is instructed to become the Tarantula to kill off any refugees who have fleed to the US.

And, finally, back in the US while the security forces clan up the school, Pete is looking for Steve ‚Äì who has disappeared.
name: You Can Go Home Again!

description: Moon Knight is hot on the trail of the sinister Cornelius Van Lunt - but considering that Van Lunt is Taurus of the late great Zodiac cartel, Moon Knight may find more than he bargained for!
name: Dead Run!

description:
The double-sized issue that's been two years in the making! The final battle with Apocalypse! New York in ruins! A traitor in the midst of X-Factor! New directions for the team! The fate of the Angel! And need we ad...the Fall Of The Mutants?

Synopsis

Apocalypse has just released his horsemen onto the world, allowing them to attack civilians. Beast and Iceman manage to work together to free the imprisoned X-Factor, allowing Marvel Girl and Cyclops to escape into the open, while Beast and Iceman remain on the ship.

On the ground, Marvel Girl assaults Famine, who gets one good shot at Jean, before being teleported away by Apocalypse. Cyclops fights war, who after Cyclops gets the upper hand, flees.

Meanwhile, Beast and Iceman are fight Apocalypse on his ship, eventually destroying the cloaking device as well as whatever keeps the ship afloat, as it crashes down. The falling ship snaps the empire state building up, which is then caught by Marvel girl for a brief second. Katie Power of Power Pack fights Pestilence, who is killed once they fall from the sky.

Jean and Scott arrive back on board, where they face off against Archangel, their old ally Warren Worthington. Iceman manages to trick Angel into believing he killed him, when it was in fact an ice duplicate of himself. All of X-Factor faces off against Apocalypse, who flees with War and Caliban in his clutches. The ship lands right on their old base, and X-Factor announces to the world the charade that they were working as mutant hunters.
name: Judgment Day

description:
Reprints dinosaur related stories from the pages of weekly British anthology comic 2000AD.

The UK edition of this comic was released as issue 14 (continuing the numbering from another QC title - Spellbinders).

Cover: Tom Grindberg (Judge Dredd)

  • Flesh - book one (parts 4-7) (progs 4-7) (Ken Armstrong/Studio Giolliti/Kelvin Gosnell - Ramon Sola)
  • Judge Dredd - Bob & Carol & Ted & Ringo (parts 3-4 - final part) (progs 348-349) (John Wagner and Alan Grant - Ron Smith)
name: Scavengers 2 (14)
